title: UMI Pipeline Nextflow Schema
description: A Nextflow pipeline to process UMI-tagged nanopore sequencing reads.

general_options.title: General - Required
general_options.description: Required parameters to define input and reference data.

input.description: Path to the input directory containing FASTQ files.

output.description: Name of the output directory where results will be stored.

reference.description: Path to the reference genome in FASTA format.

reference_fai.description: Path to the reference genome index file.

bed.description: Path to the BED file specifying target regions.

min_read_length.description: Minimum read length to retain a read.

min_qscore.description: Minimum quality score required for a read.

subsampling_seed.description: Seed value for reproducibility in subsampling.

subsampling_readnumber.description: Number of reads to retain after subsampling.

variant_caller.description: Variant caller to use (e.g., lofreq, mutserve, freebayes).

chunk_size.description: Number of reads per file for processing.

min_reads_per_barcode.description: Minimum number of reads per barcode.

umi_errors.description: Maximum allowed differences in extracted UMIs.

max_dist_umi.description: Maximum distance allowed for UMI merging.

min_reads_per_cluster.description: Minimum number of reads required for consensus cluster formation.

max_reads_per_cluster.description: Maximum number of reads used for consensus cluster formation.

clusters_per_polishing_file.description: Maximum number of clusters per polishing file.

min_consensus_quality.description: Minimum quality score for consensus reads.

filter_strategy_clusters.description: Filtering strategy for clusters exceeding max_reads_per_cluster.

output_format.description: Output format for cluster filtering step.

min_overlap.description: Minimum overlap required with target region.

balance_strands.description: Balance forward and reverse raw reads in clusters.

medaka_model.description: Medaka model used for consensus read computation.

threads.description: Number of CPU threads to use.
